message:

https://www.youtube.com/theeconomist

The way I see it is very simple. The EU should not let UK get away with this unscathed. Yes, EU is a democratic organizations. Member states can secede from the union such is the case of UK. That does not mean that anyone can bail out when times are tough. Germany and France ought to make it clear that the UK will not receive any special treatment just because is the UK. Im not British and in the end I cannot say what the british chose to do was wise or not. It is not my place. But the time of colonization is over. Britian truly has had great influence in the last couple of centuries. But I feel(and I might be wrong) that the british think that their socio-political influence is the same as it used to be 100 years ago. And I think it is not wise to burn bridges. I hope one day the british will reconsider joining  EU. Yes, EU has problems, but it is better to be united that divided. I hope that EU will survive through such turbulent times. Peace be with you friends of facebook!!!! :)

Theresa May was a "remainer" and now look at her. Where are her principles? She so desperately wanted the top job that she threw them aside, like the grubby little opportunist that she is. How can anyone trust her?
I'd say her principle is accepting the referendum and then acting in the country's best interests rather than only doing what she arrogantly thinks to be right regardless of what anyone else thinks.
If she had decency or consistency, she would have resigned and fought against the stupidity of Brexit. She's in politics for herself, not because of any ideals she might pretend to have.
"acting in the country's best interests" and "accepting the referendum" are in irreconcilable opposition.

May has no discernible principles, was a substantially useless Home Secretary Totally unfit for a leadership position and has bungled 'Brexit' 
It just frustrates me the Conservatives appointed this idiot and have left May in place despite clearly just not being suitable 

I think either Gove or Leadsome would have started the process months ago and was would Kersey have been week on the way in terms of regaining sovereignty and whatever

She put aside her personal view to deliver what the British asked her to do. That's a TRUE leader. Unlike you bitter remainiacs who have tried to derail the peoples wishes at every opportunity. You are the REAL fascists of this country. If you don't like it,the next plane leaves in an hour. You wont be missed snowflake

Joshua. Fascism isn't characterised by being a viewpoint that does not correspond with your own; rather, it's specifically concerned with nationalism and authoritarianism. Wishes do not have rails. Leadership does not mean surrendering your convictions to follow the will of those whom you know to be less well informed than yourself. And if everyone who voted remain left the country there would be no one left with a high enough IQ to operate a tin opener. Careful what you wish for.

Theresa May has had to take over from Cameron , who thought he would win the referendum. Instead he left the sinking ship as there were no plans in place should he lose the vote. How else are we going to go forward unless the people who voted to stay in recognise that the public voted to get out.

May didn't "have to" take over from anyone. There are other politicians who could have done the same job. She could have continued to fight Brexit in the interests of the millions of people whose side she was previously on. She decided to swap sides and become Prime Minister to further her own political career. She has shown a lack of principles, therefore I think she is untrustworthy. It's like an animal-rights campaigner taking a job as the managing director of a bull ring, just because it pays well. She's a traitor. She's a turncoat.

What has to happen has to happen. No point looking back. It's better for Britain now to take the initiative for herself, rather than follow suit after other nations have left the EU. Those who follow suit will be envious of Britain for being the first nation to leave.
oh my dear you do not know what you want to happen. If EU falls sooner or later there is going to be war in Europe and I think that I do not have to remind you what we have created in the past.
What exactly does England and Wales have to offer anyone? Just wondering. Love, USA

Brexit = Rats jumping from a ship that actually isn't sinking and looking quite stupid doing so.
Now EU can move forward knowing that there are no longer rats aboard.

On what grounds will there be wars? Are you saying the member nations of EU will go to war with one another? Or are you saying there will be a war with Russia? People built the Tower of Babel in order to avoid being scattered. EU is the modern-day Tower of Babel.

Which is why it is so abhorrent that Labour are using this issue of national importance as a political tool by threatening to block the Brexit deal, undermining the government's negotiations, and leaving the country with the possibility of difficulties it can then portray as being solely Tory-made. Typical Labour.
Brexit is complete idiocy

You may think that, but it's happening, and everyone, including Labour, should be doing their best to make it a success. But no. The only way Labour ever win is to show Tory (perceived) failings, so few are their successes.
No the job of the opposition is to scrutinise the government. Considering this is the most important decision in generations we need a strong opposition to hold the government to account.

Labour isn't proposing to scrutinise, it has already said that it will oppose any deal that doesn't include free movement of people - which it knows is a red line for the government, considering the feelings throughout the country - before negotiations have started, already undermining the government's efforts. They are playing politics, as usual. They have absolutely no scruples whatsoever and it is why I never have and never will vote Labour, and I'm no tribal Tory.

A strong opposition would be one that does scrutinise, does point out failings and make strong opposing arguments, and appears to be more interested in the national interest and lend maturity as gravitas to the political discourse within the country. I am reminded of the times the Tories, when in opposition, voted with the government because it was the right thing to do (no, I cannot give you specific examples, but they happened enough for me to remember that they did, as remarkable as they were).
Christopher Lang Doesn't that depend on a multitude of unknowns, in fact the same as Remaining.

Ross Duffy "everyone, including Labour, should be doing their best to make it a success". Unfortunately the success does not depend on UK's side. All the EU has to do is stay at the window and wait, doing absolutely nothing. Let the 2 years pass and wait until the UK's banks and commerce have been cut off and out of their first market. Do you think China, US, Russia as so on will rush to buy UK's goods paying them the price paid by the EU countries? Alone in a sea full of sharks ready to bite you?
Don't worry the british public have long memories and this is a very dangerous game that the Labour party is playing.

Best thing to happen to this country in years. No more cash being spent on other countries bailouts,no more child benefits for kids living in Poland,taking back our fishing waters,taking back our sovereignty that's been signed over with ever new treaty, no more EU courts over ruling British laws,finally controlling our borders and not being forced to accept fake "child" refugees who don't look a day over 30. The prime minister put aside her personal view of remain and worked to deliver what the British people asked of her. Unlike the bitter,nasty remainiacs who have tried to derail the will of the people at evey opportunity. Either get on board and make it work or go live in your beloved superstate under Merkel. You snowflakes wont be missed. A great day for this country indeed. 🇬🇧
Stfu

As if Tiny Tim's parents Mickey and Minney didn't blame themselves for fooling around but instead blamed their boss for their reproduction rights....

Meanwhile Catholic Nun wants to make sure coal miners' Tiny Tim blames their local banker Ebeneezer Scrooge McDuck for the pulmonary diseases and low wages and Democratic Male-Wombman Siren wailing....
We Europeans should not give them a deal at all, let them be grounded and the economy and wealth go down. The Common - NO - Wealth of Nations.
Don't let the largely uninformed public make such huge decisions.
Alas democracy is wasted on the stupid and uninformed.
No, Colin, Paul: let them make the decisions. But first ensure your system of education is not wholly biased against the working class.
We had the same education .
Both working class.
And yes he's right we are both working class. Common as muck in fact.
The final deal must be put to the people....if a no deal future is likely, or even a bad deal, then people have a right to determine if this is the future they want.

This referendum has shown that people are generaly stupid and will sometimes vote against their own interest.
Whatever is presented to them, the people will probably say no to it. So how long is it supposed to take then ?
In the situation, there is no deal that will be considered a good deal for britain.

In theory I agree with you, but if it's left to the politicians then Brexit will become a reality one way or another. I do believe that the public would not allow such a travesty to occur second time around & would be more likely to think carefully about what they want for their  own and their families future.  However, unlike you, many people may not be endowed with an intellect that allows for logical, rational decision making but that deficiency shouldn't alter their basic right to decide their future for themselves. 
Have a good day, if you can!
Good. One of the world's top economies won't fall that easily. People who still moan up to this day should just listen to Ode to Joy while jerking off.

So the UK is finally free from the oppressive Brussel's regime. Good thing they are still slaves to Beijing. You want proof? Taiwan. The EU allows direct flights from Taiwan. The EU allows visa free travel for Taiwanese citizens. The EU even allows parcels and mail to and from Taiwan. Even has high-level, albeit informal, government meetings. In the UK, it is so bad the Royal Mail makes it a hassle to send anything to/from Taiwan. Even have HK up without a fight. What does the UK have that the EU does not? Obedience to Beijing.
No we are still in for two years  That is the point
So you will take Beijing over Brussels?

What? Are you suggesting that parcels can't be sent from and delivered into Taiwan from China? That's a really retarded thing to suggest. And what does ccp have to do with Taiwanese travel and flights? How is leaving the EU going to affect flights? The US has direct flights to Taiwan and they are one of China's biggest traders. Visa free travel? Just get a visa like most of the rest of the world lol
That seems a bit harsh.  Isn't she just rightly doing what was agreed by the referendum.  Britain is a democracy you know!
May has to follow electoral wishes but hasn't exactly followed them appropriately

in fact Britain is the most undemocratic country of the EU, sorry to break it to you. They have a queen that is not elected, they have a senate (House of Lords) that is not elected, Theresa May was not elected as prime minister and their Parliament is unrepresentative. I personally agree with their system of Queen and House of Lords (not the Parliamentary elections) because believe it or not democracy has a great defect, the votes are equal  no matter how stupid or how smart a person is. I find it sad when Brits are condemning the EC and EU of being UNDEMOCRATIC  or even antidemocratic when they do not know how broken is their own electoral system and also seems to forget that they are part of the WTO, UN and other international organisations where people are not elected but appointed.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r9rGX91rq5I

Britain's system of government does indeed seem clumsy and potentially undemocratic and if you were to design a system from scratch you wouldn't create it.  However it wasn't designed from scratch like this.  It has evolved over 400 years and over that time has been fine tuned and tinkered with until what we have today is a system that works and delivers democracy.  For sure it's not perfect and in fact after all this time is still a work in progress, as it should be, always open to improvement.  As for your comment about the defect of democracy and some people not being smart enough to have a say, may I be so bold as to advise caution with this line of thinking.  Hitler and any number of other fascists would agree with you but in truth we are none of us as smart as we like to think we are.
Thats the issue. The EU doesnt really need the UK, but the UK really needs the EU.
and offices from London can be moved to other countries capitals.

Top ten best days of my life. Love Europe, despise the EU. Good riddance Tusk, Juncker, Merkel and co.
Oh so we need to know that we know nothing and there is no agreement on anything. Cool. Thanks.
Could be.....if.....might be.......this is not what we need to know, this is just negative speculation. Not helpful
I just hope that all  the arab money will flow away from London...to Paris, Rome and Milan.
May is in the process of selling the UK to an Arab country  Apparently incapable of comprehending that regaining sovereignty does not mean selling the UK to the highest bidder

you may be right... the only move now is to compete with switzerland and luxembrug without any EU constraints... But it would still be difficult to do business in Europe, unless London becomes a new disneyland (no business, just fun)
I'm watching the pound and the real estate prices.  Might be a good time to carpetbag.  I mean, invest.
Hopefully this is a crucial step needed to  unite the Republic of Ireland back into the 32 counties
The tone of this piece by the Economist takes on the tone of all  their previous doom mongering and seems to me like more remain propaganda disguised as comment and question.

Right, whereas The Sun is offering rigorous intellectual honesty and comes out wholly in support of Brexit, and indeed time-travel back to the 19th century. There's propaganda, and there's propaganda.
I haven't read The Sun but I think if everyone stopped offering conjecture as fact we could have a more honest and useful debate.
it's a very sad day
Sean Ryan - guess that sums up what we talked about. Ohhh...and some comments are.....worth reading.
What's next? England becomes the economic powerhouse of Europe again like they should be.
It's 1817, the dawn of a new era.

Frankly, making predictions about political outcomes is risky business. That said, structural difficulties, increasing nationalistic backlash in the face of unelected bureaucratic over reach, economic concerns and worries about national security is hastening the demise of the European project.
Or, more likely, the reform of it.
